hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via ETH/BTC Breakout Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime for BTC, if the ETH/BTC ratio breaks above its 50-day SMA while BTC's price is above its own 200-day SMA, and this is followed by a 2% single-day rally in BTC on above-average volume, the probability of a transition to a BULL regime within 3 days exceeds 60%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: ETH/BTC strength often leads broad crypto market risk-on rotations. A neutral BTC above its long-term trend is primed for an upward shift. Confirmation via BTC price momentum and volume suggests the rotation is gaining broad market participation, a hallmark of a new bullish regime.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC 4-hour close > 50-day SMA of ETH/BTC (first signal)
BTC rallies >2% on a daily candle with volume > 20-day average volume (confirmation)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio falls back below its 50-day SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: No BULL regime confirmation after 5 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: A majority (>55%) of such combined signals fail to see the FjordHQ regime classifier switch to BULL within the 5-day window.
